name: 1,2-bis(4-aminophenyl)ethanone
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2983
Reason: 1,2-Bis(4-aminophenyl)ethanone has a melting point that is influenced by several structural components. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C. The introduction of two phenyl groups and four amino groups increases the molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +20 °C per group, totaling +80 °C. The amino groups also contribute to hydrogen bonding, which raises the melting point by approximately +10 °C. The presence of two methoxy groups can also contribute to the melting point, albeit at a lower extent than the phenyl group, estimated at +2 °C for each methoxy group.
